Name: Rattlesnake
Ingredients: 52.5 ml Straight rye whiskey (100 proof /50% alc./vol.)
15 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
15 ml Egg white (pasteurised) or 																																			Aquafaba (chickpea water)																								 or 3 dashes Fee Brothers Fee Foam cocktail foamer
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Coupe glass .
Prepare garnish of lemon zest twist and aromatic bitters.
SHAKE all ingredients with ice and strain back into shaker.
Express lemon zest twist over the cocktail and discard.
Garnish with dashes of bitters pulled though the foam to resemble a snake.
Review: Spicy rye whiskey with a hint of absinthe smoothed by thick meringue-like lemony egg white.
History: The Rattlesnake first appeared as a recipe for six people in Harry Craddock's 1930 The Savoy Cocktail Book with the notation, " So-called because it will either cure Rattlesnake bite, or kill Rattlesnakes, or make you see them. " Our recipe, and the drink's newfound popularity, are influenced by a modern-day adaption by Will Elliott at Maison Premiere in Brooklyn, New York City, USA.
Nutrition: One serving of Rattlesnake contains 181 calories
